It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, showy purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs, which helps reduce water loss in its often arid habitat. Diplusodon hexander is often found growing on rocky slopes and in open grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
